result.execSummary:
The defendant Thomas J Field was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Defendant is to receive credit for 79 days.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Thomas J Field

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original Warrant has been received and destroyed
Warrant was canceled.  Talked to Charlene at GLSO.
from Clerk to Defendant re: Warrant
No Appearance by Defendant.  Court orders Warrant.

2:08 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement - defendant will plea to count 1 with no repeater and count 2 will be dismissed and read-in.  State concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1.  Court strikes the repeater.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  

90 days county jail - with sentence credit to be calculated by the jail  (79 days - per jail)
court costs - Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court adjourned at 2:15 p.m.

2:09 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Privat - defendant will waive the preliminary hearing.

Court instructs the defendant regarding his right to a preliminary examination.  Defendant waives his right to a preliminary examination.  Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Privat and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Privat enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.

Motion for Bond Modification

Argument by DA Christenson regarding motion for bond modification.  Court questions Atty Privat.  Statement by Atty Privat.  Court denies the motion and leaves bond as it.  Court will set for Status Hearing on July 21, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 2:14 p.m.

3:20 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green LAke County Jail and with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Privat confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as repeater.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 cash bond.  Defendant qualifies for PD repesentation.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant waives the time limits.  Court will set for Status Hearing with Atty Privat - June 15, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 3:24 p.m.
